definition: chance/opportunity/predestined relationship/(Buddhist) principal and secondary causes/chain of cause and effect

sentences.english: He let them be pitied by all those who held them captive.
sentences.chinese: 使他们在俘掳他们的人前，成为自己慈爱怜悯的因缘。

sentences.english: The worlds we create obey their own internal rules of causality.
sentences.chinese: 我们创造的世界亦脱不开内在因缘。

sentences.english: God said that the cause afterlife Sansheng carved in stone on top.
sentences.chinese: 神说来世的因缘刻在三生石之上。

sentences.english: Both the weapon and my body are the causes of my suffering.
sentences.chinese: 怨敌的武器与我的身体，二者都是产生痛苦的因缘。

sentences.english: This is what the Blessed One said.
sentences.chinese: 这就是《佛说阿弥陀经》的讲说因缘。

sentences.english: What is the cause of growth?
By what karma is the larva for a princess chosen?
sentences.chinese: 根据什么因缘选择这个幼体作为女王？
我知我的因缘果报存活着。

sentences.english: This article investigated its theory structure and background of establishment, in order to provide a reference to the historians.
sentences.chinese: 本文略探其理论结构和立说之因缘，以供治史者参考。

sentences.english: This is simply because Earth is complete with her karma with Sananda that this is so.
sentences.chinese: 这些仅仅是因为地球已经完成了她和萨南达的因缘。

sentences.english: Sometimes the karma is with the father and the mother leaves or deceases .
sentences.chinese: 有时因缘随父亲和母亲离开或死亡在一起联系。

sentences.english: By chance, an ancient computer led Tarter to SETI.
sentences.chinese: 因缘际会下，一部古老的电脑引领塔特进入SETI。

sentences.english: Shariputra, as I perceive that such blissful benefits are the causalities of great matters , I pronounce these words of truth.
sentences.chinese: 舍利弗，我观如是利益，安乐，大事因缘，说诚谛语。

sentences.english: Meeting and parting happen according to an intricate web of causes and conditions.
sentences.chinese: 相会与分离发生都是依照因缘状况的复杂网络。

sentences.english: With t'ao(way), causes and conditions help you overcome ignorance to realize your Buddha nature.
sentences.chinese: 只要有道，当因缘聚会，就能照破无明，见自本性。
因缘果位神马的只是神话。

definition: to be reborn/to live in paradise (Buddhism)/to die/(after) one's death
Dharma (the teachings of the Buddha)/Buddhist doctrine
karmic hindrance (buddhism)/karmic consequences that stand in the way of enlightenment/(term of abuse, especially toward the younger generation) devil spawn/(fig.) money
